text: today I'm making something really yummy
it's a sweet and savory sesame orange
chicken today I'm using cut-up chicken
and I'm making my orange juice from
scratch that's my philosophy I do know
that you can buy fresh orange juice out
there that's pretty good so if you don't
want to squeeze your own go ahead and
buy a great fresh orange juice from your
local supermarket try not to use the
stuff in the container because it's
pasteurized and it doesn't taste the
same when you're buying citrus choose
pieces of fruit that are heavy for their
size if you pick them up they should
feel a little bit weighting those will
have the most juice in them
now you can make your coding for your
chicken quarter cup of cornstarch to
that add a quarter cup of sesame seeds
the Sesame's and the sesame orange
chicken and then two egg whites save the
yolks for something else teaspoon of
salt coarse salt not the fine salt you
don't want it too salty and a half a
teaspoon of freshly ground black pepper
it's a nice flavorful coating for your
chicken mix everything together the
cornstarch will give it a nice crispness
as will the egg white when your mixture
is fully combined you can add your
chicken its a pound and a half a
boneless skinless chicken breast I cut
these into pieces that are first off
right do it yourself if you have the
time when everything is well coated you
can start cooking aids I'm using a
nonstick skillet over here you're going
to use a total of approximately a
quarter cup of vegetable oil to cook
your chicken in and you want to do it in
batches because the idea is to get it
nice and crispy and not crowding the pan
is probably the best way to do that add
your chicken make sure the oil is hot
you can tell the oil is hot when it's
shimmering and when it sizzles cook
until they're golden brown and cooked
through shouldn't take more than a
couple minutes per side this dish would
also be really good with shrimp as in
the original recipe but also pork and
even beef work well here sometimes
chicken if it has a lot of moisture in
it will pop the oil and a little bit of
oil will fly out so be careful the key
for delicious chicken breast is not
overcooking it but cooking it just
through some of the thicker pieces you
might want to turn on their side just so
they get a little bit of heat from the
side that
little fixture to make sure as long as
they feel firm when you're touching when
you're pressing down on them like really
firm then they're done as they're done
take them out and drain it on paper
towels and then just replace with more
chicken now your chicken has a nice
crunchy coating of sesame seeds and a
little bit of egg white any excess oil
in the pan you can wipe it out but my
pan looks not too bad so I'm just gonna
start adding my ingredients right here
in the same pan four scallions sliced 2
tablespoons of soy sauce tablespoon of
sugar and your cup of orange juice
I simmer this for two to four minutes
just until it gets a little bit
thickened and then you can add your
chicken back in and toss it to cook you
don't want to overdo it because the
chicken is already cooked somewhere
everything together really does smell
good chicken gets nicely coated with
your slightly thickened sauce it'll
thicken just a little bit more when you
add it in because of the cornstarch but
not a lot so get it nice and reduced
dinner is ready get every last bit of
that sauce you want to put some fresh
scallions on at the end I think that's a
great idea you want to up the fragrance
bounty on this fantastic sesame orange
chicken at home made by you
